Challenge Prompt
```py
n=p*q*r
assert b*(x**2)+d == x**3 + c*x
flag=bytes_to_long(flag)
ct=pow(flag,e,n)
```
We are given
```py
a=1



e=0x10001
```

__Solution__

We need roots of the cubic equation given to us.
We used sage math to find the roots. We got 3 roots. 2 of them very big one is slightly smaller.
```py
roots =  [, , 7225548771041502570752002536020549394365933528727218309350162102713420837654007061436190617046018768891910323719813060341211870518261051399389763851682057]
```

Then we can check all of them on `http://factordb.com/index.php` to see if any of them is prime or we get factors of any of them.

After checking that we have
1. roots[0] is perfect square of a prime number. We can assume that this sqrt(roots[0]) is one of the numbers say p.
2. roots[2] is a prime number. Hence we can assume it also one of the numbers say q.
3. Now to find r we simply divide n by p*q.

```py
pqr = [11028780747245702999399582287572422141860235227169584753700396836978683591866678949333185731496840507050073213352286079907426425697620387818057555212467027, x[2], 9931852409111441803548946889619359095211948865688705654282179803242049937272278415968476455693954007505687204320789626803285531310303921968435241366305211]
```

Now that we have factors of n we can cimpute phi
```py
phi = (pqr[0]-1)*(pqr[1]-1)*(pqr[2]-1)
```
$\because$ d.e = 1 mod phi(n) & plaintextMessage = ciphertext<sup>d</sup> mod n
```py
d = pow(e,-1,phi)
msg = pow(ct,d,n)
print(bytes.fromhex(hex(msg)[2:]).decode())
```
